intro: Scleria unguiculata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and spike-like inflorescences. Scleria unguiculata typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, often in shallow water or along the edges of ponds and streams. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
